text: Eals Bridge is a stone bridge across the River South Tyne near Knarsdale in Northumberland. ==History== This structure has two stone arches and was completed in 1733 but seriously damaged by flooding in 1829. Widened in 1973, it carries road traffic and is a Grade II listed structure. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northumberland Category:Crossings of the River Tyne
title: Eals Bridge
